result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Signed and filed: Order for Competency Examination
Received and Filed: Proposed Order for Competency

Defendant Jerome Fuller Gee not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Jerome Fuller Gee.  Attorney Amanda Kirklewski in court on behalf of Attorney James C Griffin for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a return on warrant.  Defense requests a competency examination.  No objection from the State.  Court ordered competency examination by DHS.  Court scheduled a Doctor's Report Return.  Order for competency signed and filed by the Court.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on October 20, 2022.  Original bench warrant scanned.  Case is adjourned until October 24, 2022 at 8:30 AM for Return on Bench Warrant in Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.  Notice is given to Defense Counsel and District Attorney.

Received and Filed.

Defendant Jerome Fuller Gee not in court.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Jerome Fuller Gee.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued with REMAND TO JUDGE upon return of the bench warrant. Court took no action on bail.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Jerome Fuller Gee appeared by video.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted appeared by video for Jerome Fuller Gee.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a return on warrant.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court takes no action on bail.  Court addresses Justice Point violations.  All previously ordered conditions of bail remain in full effect.  Court ordered the defendant to appear at all court dates, charge GPS, and to comply with all court orders.  Case adjourned for a status conference in Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jerome Fuller Gee not in court.  
Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Jerome Fuller Gee.  
Attorney Erika Strebel for  James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Scheduling Conference. Defendant failed to appear.
Court is in receipt of ADA Griffin Motion to Re-tab this case to Branch 2 due to tabbing error. 
Defense Motion Granted. Court ordered this case to be transferred to Branch 2 forthwith.
Due to defendant's failure to appear court ordered case be calendared for a Calendar Call before Branch 2.
Calendar call scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: State's Motion to Re-Tab this case to Branch 2 for further proceedings.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Jerome Fuller Gee, in court, appear by video with attorney Michael B Plaisted, appear by video.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Benitez.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Court Remind defendant of active No Contact Order, and conditions with Justice Point. Case is adjourned to Branch 45.   
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney Michael Plaisted

Defendant Jerome Fuller Gee in court, in person.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Matthew Plaisted is on vacation. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6-16-2022, Filed
Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense

Defendant Jerome Fuller Gee in court, in custody.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jerome Fuller Gee appeared by video means. Defendant does not qualify for the State Public Defender representation. Court appoints Michael Plaisted at county expense. Court orders reimbursement at $50.00 per month. Case is adjourned in preliminary court.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense

Defendant Jerome Fuller Gee not in court, defendant in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant is not produced.  Defendant does not have retained counsel at this time.   Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing in Br. 45  Indigency hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CM; 
3900 Block of N. 41 St., including the alley between 40th and 41st Streets.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  OVERRIDE.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.

Defendant Jerome Fuller Gee in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Jerome Fuller Gee in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jerome Fuller Gee appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
